hackathon-description-text: BC Game Jam is an annual event that unites game devloper within all the disciplines in developing game within a limited time frame. What differentiates BC Game Jam from other similar events is the focus on inviting high-school and post-secondary students to participate. We provide these students with support and mentorship to create a true learning experience. Attendees are given the opportunity to showcase their games at the end of the event for some awesome prizes.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: East Side Games - Game Design Director

hackathon-eligibility: Anyone is welcome. For students with student ticket, please bring your student ID
hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Great Hall, Building SE2, 3700 Willingdon Ave, Burnaby, BC V5G 3H2, Canada

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion:
Sponsors will judge the games based on the sub-theme the team participates in.
Here are the themes:
Main Theme: Resolution
East Side Games: Weird
UBC Emerging Media Lab: Health & Learning
Blackbird Interactive: Games as Art
BCIT: Educational
IUGO: Dreams

hackathon-location-address: Great Hall, Building SE2, 3700 Willingdon Ave, Burnaby, BC V5G 3H2, Canada
